Financial Aid Fact Sheet For Study Abroad

Study abroad courses are considered courses offered at an additional location. This is different from a Study Abroad Program where students attend a foreign institution under a consortium agreement.

• There is no federal or state financial aid specifically for study abroad.

• The same federal, state, and institutional policies regarding financial aid apply to study abroad courses.

• Funds (including HOPE) can be applied toward tuition/fees/charges when awarded and show as pending on the Duck under “HOW MUCH DO I OWE?”

• Aid over and above charges is refunded to the HigherOne Card by the Bursar’s Office within 14 days after the regular semester schedule adjustment period. No funds (including HOPE) are available prior to the refund.

• Students awarded for Fall/Spring may request review for summer aid by completing the Request for Financial Aid for Summer Semester on the Duck Message Portal in January or early February. Summer awarding is a manual process, so please complete the survey early! • Students who are only eligible for loans and took their entire loan amount Fall/Spring will not have any aid for summer unless they increase from freshman to sophomore or sophomore to junior OR get a Parent PLUS Loan (dependent students only).

• Students must be enrolled at least half-time to be eligible for loans including Parent PLUS loans. A student who has loan eligibility but takes only a 3 hour study abroad course will not be eligible for the loan.

• Recommendations for funding study abroad: o Plan early o Save refunds from prior semesters o Apply for private scholarships (and report them to financial aid if received) o Consider private loans and credit cards as a last resort
